title: American Cinema
lyrics:
(American cinema, American cinema)
(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

Let me lasso down the moon for you Mary, my Mary
I ain't ever been [?], [these ships?] never last long
The perfect picture of ordinary

I'm a Virgo, you're a Cancer, I guess this doesn't really matter



The train never left the station, life never worked for him

The lights went on as she walked in



Just like American cinema (American cinema)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

American cinema (American cinema)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)



Boy meets girl, girl says no

You queue the hard times, the panic mode

He texts her (He texts her) She feels the cold (She feels the cold)

And just like that the kids look ready to roll

Like American (American) American cinema



'Cause you spend your life waiting for clocks just to strike

Well I'm no Prince Charming, you're no Cinderella

We all need someone to kiss us goodbye

I won't believe in happy endings, just [?] stories



The train never left the station, life never worked for him

The lights went on as she walked in



Just like American cinema (American cinema)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

American cinema (American cinema)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)



Boy meets girl, girl says no

And queue the hard times, the panic mode

He texts her (He texts her) She feels the cold (She feels the cold)

And just like that the kids look ready to roll

Like American (American) American cinema



I'll be your Josh, you'll be my Mary

We'll build this mansion from the dreams that we buried

I'll be your pills, you'll be my bandage

Fuel my illusions, realize your tactic



American cinema...

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

American cinema (American cinema)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)



Boy meets girl, girl says no

You queue the hard times, the panic mode

He texts her (He texts her) She feels the cold (She feels the cold)

And just like that the kids look ready to roll

Like American (American) American cinema

American (American) American cinema

American (American) American cinema



A-two-three-four

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

Let the credits roll, let the credits roll

(The credits roll)

(Dada-dada-dada-dadadada, dada-dada-dada-dadadada)

Let the credits roll, let the credits roll
